## NiN 2.0 Naturtype Mapping

*short description here*

:::{.note}
**Note** that this QField Template is designed for mapping NiN 2.0. From 2026 onwards NiN 3.0 will be used as mapping protocol. As of today, there is no QGIS Template available for NiN 3.0. 
:::

### Install NiN QField on your tablet

The **NiN 2.0** QGIS template is uploaded to NINA's QField Cloud account. For general instructions on QGIS, QField and QField Cloud follow the guide: [QGIS and QField introduciton](intro-to-qfield.qmd).

1. Open QField on your tablet and go to `QFieldCloud projects` > `My Projects` 
2. Select the project and the latest version of the project will be downloaded to your tablet.
    - **nin2_project_name_year**: project specific NiN mapping template.
    - **nin2_norge_2024**: NiN mapping template for the whole of Norway.

    *It can take up to several minutes to download your project*

3. Set your user name in the QField app. This ensures that your name is automatically added to the `kartlegger` field in the attribute table, every time you map a new naturtype.
    - Go to `Settings` > `Settings` > `Variables` 
    - Add a new variable `qfield_user_name` with your name `firstname.lastname`

### How to create a new NiN 2.0 project? 

0. Read the PDF instructions, especially chapter 2 "Installering og oppstart" and chapter 3 "Kartlegging av NiN-Naturtyper".
1. In the folder `vector` create the GPKG-files:
    - %project_name%_misc.gpkg
    - %project_name%_extent.gpkg 
    - %project_name%_condition.gpkg *(only if you plan to record additional condition parameters, such as soil depth)*
    - %project_name%_service.gpkg *(only if you plan to record additional service parameters)*

1. Create a new polygon layer `study_area` and save it to `misc` GPKG and add it to the `Area` group. 

2. Download raster files in `GeoTIFF` format from [høydedata.no](https://hoydedata.no/) and [norgeibilder.no](https://www.norgeibilder.no/). 
    - DTMs and DSMs: [høydedata.no](https://hoydedata.no/)
    - Ortophotos (RGB and CIR): [norgeibilder.no](https://www.norgeibilder.no/)
        - Login with your Geonorge GeoID
        - enter study area bounding box coordinates 
        - Coordinate system: UTM 33
        - clip by bounding box 
        - send order
3. Add your downloaded raster files as offline map layers in QField. 



Changes compared to the orignal file
- NiN shp-files are saved in the GPKG
- admin field is added for "kartlegger"
- possibility to add points for soil depth measurements 

- add user name:
    - qfield app > setttings > settings > variables
    - new variable `qfield_user_name` with your name

## CarbonViewer 

The CarbonViewer app calculates the **total volume of peat (m3)** and the **total carbon content (Tons C)** in a peatland area. To be able to calculate those values the peatland area must be sampled for peat depth and the peatland type must be recorded. 

:::{.note}
**Note** that [CarbonViewer](https://carbonviewer.nina.no/) is not a field application! The user must go out in the field and record peat depth (cm) and the coordinates of the measurements before using CarbonViewer.
:::
